page.title: 02WRINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: WRINGTON IS SURROUNDED BY FARMLAND, MAINLY ROUGH GRAZING AND CULTIVATED GRASSLAND. TO THE NORTH IS WOODLAND. THERE ARE FOUR ROADS LEADING TO THE CENTRE OF THE VILLAGE; THEY ARE NARROW AND HAVE SUBSTANTIAL HEDGEROWS MAKING IT HARD FOR VEHICLES TO PASS IN PLACES. IN WRINGTON THERE IS A PRIMARY SCHOOL,A POST OFFICE,A FEW PUBLIC HOUSES,A GARAGE,A CHURCH,A PLAYING FIELD AND A FEW SHOPS.THERE ARE NO LARGE SUPERMARKETS. TO THE SOUTH OF THE VILLAGE IS A SMALL INDUSTRIAL ESTATE WITH BUSINESSES LIKE MOTOR ENGINEERS AND WOOD TECHNICIANS.THIS ESTATE IS ON THE SITE OF THE FORMER RAILWAY LINE RUNNING FROM LOWER LANGFORD TO THE MAIN LINE AT YATTON.
